metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5158 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in vringh_kiov_advance in drivers/vhost/vringh.c in the host side of a virtio ring in the Linux Kernel. This issue may result in a denial of service from guest to host via zero length descriptor.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-90.100
linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-90.100
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-90.100
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic-64k - 5.15.0-90.100
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1025-oem - 6.1.0-1025.25
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-90.100
linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-90.100
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-90.100
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic-64k - 5.15.0-90.100
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1025-oem - 6.1.0-1025.25
No subscription required
